headline: XEOS inaugurates CFM LEAP maintenance in Poland
summary: GE Aerospace (NYSE: GE) today announced the inauguration of XEOS, a state-of-the-art engine maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility in Środa Śląska near Wrocław. A joint venture between GE Aerospace and Lufthansa Technik, the facility is focused on the overhaul and repair of CFM International* LEAP engines, which power today's most popular narrowbody aircraft. These include CFM LEAP-1A engines for the Airbus A320neo family and CFM LEAP-1B engines for the Boeing 737 MAX aircraft.
